page.title: 18Fishing-Trout and Salmon
page.content: The{fishing rights}on the Tamar river from New Bridge to Horsebridge are {owned privately by two parties}but {jurisdiction over the water is held by the{S.W.Water Authority.}Once,there was a good stock of{salmon}and{brown {trout.}Now {pollution from household {waste}and{chemical fertilizers}appears to have had a{damaging effect on the {numbers of fish.Poaching}for salmon is now carried out in a more organized way.{Water bailiffs are employed}and their many duties include general maintenance of river banks as well as checking fishermen for licences. They are empowered to stop, search and arrest if necessary. Birds, such as {kingfishers, dippers and herons}are to be found along the river.As for mammals, there has been{a significant {increase in the number of mink but no {sign of otters in recent years.
